definition: a person who has been converted to another religious or political belief, to change in nature, purpose, or function
details:
noun
- a person who has been converted to another religious or political belief
verb
- to change in nature, purpose, or function
- to change the nature, purpose, or function of something
= example: to change the nature, purpose, or function of something
- to exchange or replace with another, usually of the same kind or category
= example: to exchange or replace with another, usually of the same kind or category
= synonyms: exchange
- to exchange a penalty for a less severe one
= synonyms: exchange
- to change from one system to another or to a new plan or policy
= example: to change from one system to another or to a new plan or policy
= synonyms: change over
- to change religious beliefs, or adopt a religious belief
= example: to change religious beliefs, or adopt a religious belief
- to cause to adopt a new or different faith
= example: to cause to adopt a new or different faith
- to make someone agree, understand, or realize the truth or validity of something
= synonyms: win over, convince
- to score a spare
- to complete successfully
- to score an extra point or points after touchdown by kicking the ball through the uprights or advancing the ball into the end zone
= example: to score an extra point or points after touchdown by kicking the ball through the uprights or advancing the ball into the end zone
